dt: {bc}a single thread or a thin flexible threadlike object, process, or appendage {dx_def}see {dxt|appendage||2}{/dx_def}: such as
{bc}a tenuous {dx_def}see {dxt|tenuous||2}{/dx_def} conductor (as of carbon or metal) made incandescent by the passage of an electric current
{bc}a cathode {dx_def}see {dxt|cathode||2}{/dx_def} in the form of a metal wire in an {d_link|electron tube|electron tube}
{bc}a thin and fine elongated constituent part of a gill {dx_def}see {dxt|gill:2||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}an elongated thin series of cells attached one to another or a very long thin cylindrical single cell (as of some algae, fungi, or bacteria)

et: Middle French, from Medieval Latin {it}filamentum{/it}, from Late Latin {it}filare{/it} to spin {ma}{mat|file|}{/ma}
shortdef: a single thread or a thin flexible threadlike object, process, or appendage : such as
a tenuous conductor (as of carbon or metal) made incandescent by the passage of an electric current; specifically : a cathode in the form of a metal wire in an electron tube
a thin and fine elongated constituent part of a gill
